2022-01-19T20-43-43Z.message: Actions job or workflow does not limit the permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN. Consider setting an explicit permissions block, using the following as a minimal starting point: {{}}
The workflow is using a known vulnerable version ([v5.1](1)) of the [tj-actions/branch-names](2) action. Update it to [7.07](3)

2022-01-19T20-43-43Z.workflow:
# We need a Docker image to be built and stored in order to run e2e tests
name: Docker Build

on:
    push:
        branches:
            - "**"

env:
    REGISTRY: ghcr.io

jobs:
    docker:
        runs-on: ubuntu-latest
        steps:
            - name: Get branch name
              id: branch-name
              uses: tj-actions/branch-names@v5.1
            - name: Set up QEMU
              uses: docker/setup-qemu-action@v1
            - name: Set up Docker Buildx
              uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v1
            - name: Login to GitHub Container Registry
              uses: docker/login-action@v1
              with:
                  registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
                  username: ${{ github.repository_owner }}
                  password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
            - name: Extract Docker metadata
              id: meta
              uses: docker/metadata-action@v3
              with:
                  # owner/repository
                  # the action also takes care of making it docker-compatible
                  images: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ github.repository }}
            - name: Build and push
              id: docker_build
              uses: docker/build-push-action@v2
              with:
                  push: true
                  tags: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
                  labels: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.labels }}
                  cache-from: type=gha
                  cache-to: type=gha,mode=max
